fields.label: Display "Back" button
fields.description: Display button for navigating back to your previous scene

fields.label: Scene Description
fields.description: A text that can describe the scene for the end-user

fields.label: Display "Scene Description" initially
fields.description: Display the scene description when the scene starts for the first time

fields.label: Initial camera position
fields.description: Camera position in pitch and yaw

fields.label: Label
fields.description: If left blank no label will be displayed and we'll try to use the title field for screen readers

fields.label: Label position
fields.description: Choose where the label should appear

fields.label: Display Label
fields.description: If hidden - labels will show only on mouse over

fields.label: Button style
fields.description: Decide how the icon should look.

fields.label: Button style
fields.description: Decide how buttons pointing to this scene should look. For scenes that are static and does not lead to new scenes, we recommend the "More information" button.

fields.label: Audio Track
fields.description: Add an audio track that's specific for this scene.

semantics.label: Behavioural settings
semantics.description: These options will let you control how the world behaves.

fields.label: Global Audio
fields.description: Add an audio track that's available for all of the scenes by default.

fields.label: Scene rendering quality
fields.description: Choose the amount of width and height segments used to render a scene. This directly affects the quality level of the scene, try increasing the quality if a scene looks "blocky" or "waves" are seen within the scenes. Note that higher quality rendering takes more time to load.

fields.label: Label position
fields.description: The default label position. The position may be overriden per interaction

fields.label: Display Labels
fields.description: If unchecked - labels will show only on mouse over

fields.label: Show as hotspot
fields.description: Show as a hidden hotspot, can used for overlaying interaction on elements in image

fields.label: Show hotspot when mouse is hovering
Show as open content in the scene
fields.description: Allows the content to be shown in an open dialog box directly in the scene.

fields.label: Values for storing the height and width for hotspot
Password for the interaction
fields.description: If not empty, the user has to input the password in order to open this content.

fields.label: A hint for the interaction code
fields.description: An optional hint for the code, can be left empty if wanted

fields.label: Label for button to reset camera
Label for the submit dialog button
Label for the close dialog button
Aria label for the expand label button
Label for when background image is loading in 360 scene
Label for when there is no content
